lessons.mission: 🕵️ MISSION: The Bug Hunter. Open 3 apps you use daily. Find 5 interface 'violations' based on the reading. Score 1 point for each!
🛠️ MISSION: The Patcher. Take your 5 bugs from yesterday. Sketch 5 solutions on paper in 30 minutes. Time yourself!
🎨 MISSION: Contrast Cop. Download the 'Stark' plugin. Find 3 websites with bad text contrast and 'fix' them using new hex codes.
🗣️ MISSION: The Screen Reader Challenge. Turn on your phone's VoiceOver/TalkBack. Try to navigate a website with your eyes closed for 5 mins.
🎯 MISSION: Fat Finger Test. Measure buttons on your favorite app. If any are under 44px redesign the button to be thumb-friendly.
✅ MISSION: The Master List. Create your own 'Flight Manual' checklist. You must include at least 10 items from this week's learnings.
📸 MISSION: Show Off. Post a 'Before & After' image of your Tuesday redesign on Twitter/LinkedIn.
⚛️ MISSION: Atom Smasher. Draw a website interface on paper. Circle the 'atoms' (buttons icons) in red and 'molecules' (search bars) in blue.
🧩 MISSION: Flexbox Froggy. Recreate a complex card component in Figma using Auto-Layout. It must resize perfectly without breaking!
📚 MISSION: The Librarian. Rename 20 messy layers in your Figma file to follow a strict naming convention (e.g. Button/Primary/Active).
📝 MISSION: The Storyboard. Write the 'Hero's Journey' for a user using your app. Problem (Monster) -> Solution (Weapon) -> Victory.
🗺️ MISSION: Map Maker. Create a User Flow for buying a coffee. If there are fewer than 5 steps you missed something. Add more detail!
🎤 MISSION: The Pitch. Record yourself explaining your project in exactly 60 seconds. If you stutter start over!
🚀 MISSION: Launch Day. Publish one small UI component to the Figma Community (or just prepare the file as if you were).
🏗️ MISSION: The Architect. Download a free UI Kit. Try to break it by resizing elements. Note what breaks and why.
🤝 MISSION: Dev Buddy. Pretend you are a developer. Export all your icons as SVGs and your photos as JPGs. Are they named correctly?
🏎️ MISSION: Speed Run. Design a 'Music Player' screen using ONLY your UI kit components. You have 30 minutes. Go!
✍️ MISSION: Hemingway Challenge. Find a confusing error message online. Rewrite it to be clear, friendly, and under 10 words.
🚫 MISSION: Oops! Design a 404 page that isn't boring. Make the user smile even though they are lost.
🌍 MISSION: The Translator. Take your 5 most common UI labels (Submit, Login, etc.) and check if they work if translated to German.
🎁 MISSION: The Package. Create a stunning 'Cover Image' for your UI Kit that would make someone want to download it immediately.
🦁 MISSION: Brand Yourself. Pick 3 adjectives that describe you (e.g. Minimalist, Bold, Friendly). Choose 1 font and 1 color that matches.
🧱 MISSION: The Skeleton. Sketch the layout of your portfolio Homepage on paper. Don't touch the computer until the sketch is done!
✨ MISSION: The Kerning Game. Go to type.method.ac and play the kerning game to train your eye for typography spacing.
🤔 MISSION: The Interview. Call a friend. Ask them about the last time they had a bad travel experience. Write down 3 pain points.
Cc8️⃣ MISSION: Crazy 8s. Fold a paper into 8 squares. Sketch 8 different solutions to your friend's travel problem in 8 minutes.
🧪 MISSION: Lab Coat. Show your sketches to a family member. Ask 'What do you think this button does?' Don't explain anything!
📁 MISSION: Case Closed. Compile your interview notes, Crazy 8 sketches, and final idea into a simple Notion page or slide deck.
🪙 MISSION: Tokenize. Replace 5 hard-coded colors (e.g. #0000FF) in your design with variables (e.g. 'Color-Primary').
💫 MISSION: Alive! Create a button in Figma that changes size slightly when you hover and clicks down when pressed.
📜 MISSION: The Manual. Write instructions for a developer explaining exactly how your 'Hover' animation from yesterday should work.
🧠 MISSION: Brain Hack. Find a cluttered menu online. Apply Hick's Law by hiding half the options under a 'More' button.
💃 MISSION: The Choreographer. Animate a card sliding in from the bottom of the screen. Make it feel 'bouncy' and fun.
🎉 MISSION: Confetti. Design a 'Success' screen that rewards the user. Add a visual celebration element (confetti, high-five, checkmark).
🎥 MISSION: Movie Star. Record your screen showing off the interactions you built this week. Narrate why you chose those animations.
🎨 MISSION: Mood Board. Create a mood board for a fictional 'Meditation App'. It must feel 'Calm' but NOT use the color blue.
🔄 MISSION: The Rebrand. Take a wireframe. Apply your 'Meditation App' styles (fonts/colors) to it to see how the vibe changes.
📢 MISSION: Call to Action. Rewrite the button 'Submit' to be more enticing. Try 5 variations (e.g. 'Start my Journey').
🧐 MISSION: Roast Yourself. Open your own portfolio. Find 3 things that are confusing or broken. Be ruthless!
🔥 MISSION: Heat Seeker. Look at a heatmap example. Identify the 'cold' spot where nobody is clicking.
📱 MISSION: Squish Test. Resize your portfolio browser window to mobile width. Does anything overlap or disappear? Fix it.
✍️ MISSION: The Influencer. Draft a LinkedIn post sharing the top 3 mistakes you found in your own portfolio on Thursday.
⌨️ MISSION: No Mouse Monday. Unplug your mouse. Try to navigate your favorite online store using only 'Tab' and 'Enter'.
🧭 MISSION: The Final Boss. Define the problem for your Capstone project. Write it in one sentence. "I am solving X for [User] because [Reason]."
🖼️ MISSION: Pixel Perfect. Design the main 'Home' screen for your Capstone. It must score 100% on accessibility contrast.
🔗 MISSION: The Flow. Connect your screens so a user can complete one full task without getting stuck.
📖 MISSION: Documentation Day. Take screenshots of your messy "Work in Progress". Case studies love showing the messy middle!
💎 MISSION: Shine. Check every single padding pixel. Is it consistent? If you use 8px spacing, make sure it's 8px everywhere.
🚀 MISSION: BLAST OFF. Publish your portfolio. Send the link to 3 friends and ask them to break it. Then, apply for 1 job.
